page.title: 07RAUNDS
page.content: {RAUNDS CHURCH. Raunds church was built in medieval times.It has many important and interesting features including a 15th century 24 hour clock in the tower arch.The brass chandelier in the nave dates from 1762.There are also some 15th century brasses and wall paintings.The left handed fiddler on the spire is believed to be unique.{ {GAGE MANOR. By the 14th century it was owned partly by the king and the Earl of Lancaster.The manor is stone built and there is a large western cross wing in which is an entrance. {THORPE MANOR.} Thorpe house is stone built and there is a large tall monkey tree in front of the manor.There are two large chimney stacks on the back of the house and a large porch.
